low.question: Who led the Salt March to Dandi in 1930 as part of the civil disobedience movement?

In which year was the Indian National Congress founded?
Who is popularly known as the 'Iron Man of India' for leading a campaign against princely rule?
Which movement did Mahatma Gandhi call off after the Chauri Chaura violence in 1922?
What was the main objective of the Quit India Movement launched in 1942?
Which empire built the rock edicts and spread Buddhism after the Kalinga War?
Which city was the center of the Revolt of 1857 where the rebellion began in May?
Who founded the Indian National Congress along with Indian leaders in 1885?
Which leader famously declared 'Do or Die' during the Quit India Movement?
Which princely queen fought against the British in the 1857 rebellion and became a national heroine?
Which act of 1909 introduced separate electorates for Muslims in British India?
Who wrote the nationalist newspaper Kesari and was a prominent leader of the Extremist movement?
Which ancient urban civilization had major sites at Harappa and Mohenjo-daro?
Which movement in 1930 involved breaking the salt law as symbolic protest?
Who served as the first Prime Minister of independent India in 1947?
Which leader founded the All India Muslim League in 1906?
Which 1858 proclamation transferred authority from the East India Company to the British Crown?
Which leader led the Champaran Satyagraha in 1917, Gandhi's first active struggle in India?
Who authored the book 'Discovery of India' while imprisoned during the freedom struggle?
Which treaty in 1809 gave the British control over foreign affairs of the Nizam of Hyderabad?
What was the main demand of the Swadeshi Movement beginning in 1905?
Which Mughal emperor commissioned the Taj Mahal in memory of his wife Mumtaz Mahal?
Which leader popularized the slogan 'Swaraj is my birthright' in the early 20th century?
Which 1915 return of an expatriate leader revitalized Indian nationalism?
Which British law in 1919 curtailed civil liberties and led to widespread protest?
Who led the Home Rule Movement in India alongside Annie Besant and Bal Gangadhar Tilak?
Which Indian leader formed the Forward Bloc after differences with the Congress in 1939?
Which battle in 1526 marked the beginning of Mughal rule in India?

medium.question: Which treaty in 1765 granted the East India Company the Diwani rights of Bengal, Bihar and Orissa?
Who chaired the committee that produced the Montagu-Chelmsford Reforms leading to the Government of India Act 1919?
Which Indian reformer founded the Brahmo Samaj in 1828 promoting monotheism and social reform?
Which regiment's issue with greased cartridges sparked the 1857 Sepoy Mutiny?
Which city served as the capital of the British in India before New Delhi became capital in 1911?
Which 1935 act provided provincial autonomy and proposed an all-India federation subject to princely states?
Which Indian leader organized the Simon Commission protests with the slogan 'Simon Go Back' in 1928?
Who presided over the 1929 Lahore Session where 'Purna Swaraj' was declared?
Which movement beginning in 1905 protested the partition of Bengal and promoted indigenous industry?
Which battle in 1764 established British dominance after victory over the Nawab of Bengal?
Which Indian leader formed the Hindustan Socialist Republican Association (HSRA) in 1928?
options: Chandrasekhar Azad and Ram Prasad Bismil
medium.answer: Chandrasekhar Azad and Ram Prasad Bismil

medium.question: Which year marks the signing of the Treaty of Seringapatam that ended the Third Anglo-Mysore War?
Who instituted the Ryotwari system for revenue collection in parts of South India?
Which leader is known for the campaign against untouchability and led movements for Dalit rights?
Which city hosted the Cripps Mission negotiations in 1942 seeking Indian support during World War II?
Which Indian ruler established the Mughal dynasty's greatest territorial expansion under his reign?
Who authored 'Annihilation of Caste', a critique of caste and social orthodoxy?
Which congress leader led the Bardoli Satyagraha in 1928 and later became Prime Minister of Bombay Presidency?
Which Indian regiment famously rebelled in Kanpur during the 1857 uprising under Nana Sahib?
Which act introduced separate electorates for depressed classes in 1932 mediated by Poona Pact discussions?
Which leader started the Home Rule League in 1916 to demand self-government within the British Empire?
options: Both Annie Besant and Bal Gangadhar Tilak
medium.answer: Both Annie Besant and Bal Gangadhar Tilak

medium.question: Which Mughal emperor faced the Maratha resurgence led by Shivaji in the 17th century?
Which movement protested the British salt monopoly and led to mass civil disobedience across India in 1930?
Which Indian leader resigned from the Congress over the issue of supporting Britain's World War II effort?
Which 1877 proclamation by Queen Victoria promised to respect Indian rights after the 1857 rebellion?
Which hill station in India served as the initial headquarters of the Indian National Army in Southeast Asia?
options: None; INA HQ was in Singapore region
medium.answer: None; INA HQ was in Singapore region

medium.question: Which 1920 act expanded Indian participation in legislative councils and reformed civil services examinations?
Which Indian princely state rejected accession to Pakistan and joined India in 1947 after a police action?

hard.question: Which satyagrahi led the Kheda movement in 1918 advocating relief for peasants facing crop failure?

Which act of 1833 abolished the East India Company's commercial activities, making it solely an administrative body?
Which early 20th century leader promoted 'Tilakism' and used mass festivals to mobilize support for independence?
Which British official introduced the Permanent Settlement in 1793 altering land revenue relations in Bengal?
Who was the first Indian to preside over the Indian National Congress session in 1888?
Which 1907 split in the Congress divided it into Moderates and Extremists at which city session?
Which leader founded the Servants of India Society in 1905 to promote social reform and education?
Which treaty ended the Third Anglo-Maratha War and marked the effective end of Maratha sovereignty in 1818?

Which leader authored the pamphlet 'Why I am an Atheist' and influenced revolutionary youth in early 20th century India?
Which province's peasant uprising in 1937 was led by the Tebhaga movement demanding two-thirds share for tenants?
Which body replaced the Indian Councils under reforms of 1861 expanding legislative participation marginally?
Which 1799 event led to the fall of Tipu Sultan and increased British control in South India?

Which 19th century movement in Maharashtra emphasized Vedic revivalism and challenged orthodox practices?
Which colonial policy defined the Doctrine of Lapse used by Lord Dalhousie to annex Indian states?
options: Annexation by failure of natural heirs
hard.answer: Annexation by failure of natural heirs

hard.question: Which peasant leader led the Bardoli Satyagraha's local committee demanding tax rollback in 1928?
